content.title: wot-v0.7.md drafted
content.body: Full spec with 11 new sections: rework chains, source attribution, hallucination floor, OLP metrics, etc.

content.title: Pool-Peer-Rules = Keyvault
content.body: Keyvaults and shared secrets collapse to three primitives: pool (trust boundary), peer (exchange partner), rules (what pool requires). No separate secret management system needed.

content.title: Marketing traces separation
content.body: Create wot-marketing-traces.md to collect website-sourceable content separately from technical traces. Sources for wot.rocks, wot.technology, now.pub.

content.title: WoT domain portfolio
content.body: Domains held: wot.rocks, wot.technology, wot.digital, wot.mobi, wot.services, wotwot.uk. More than remembered.

content.title: GitHub org: wot-technology
content.body: wot taken on GitHub. Going with wot-technology to match docs domain. Alternatives considered: wellspring-wot, wotrocks, wot-protocol.

content.title: Zero Trust vs WoT analysis
content.body: Zero Trust ('never trust, always verify') aligns with WoT principles but differs on enforcement: ZT uses central policy engines (Cloudflare/Okta), WoT uses distributed trust computation. Complementary not competing.

content.title: Predefined aspect trees
content.body: Technical aspects (device posture, identity verification) can be predefined as connected hierarchies via instance_of. Pool rules reference root, protocol resolves descendants. Extensible without breaking rules.

content.title: wot.services ingestion layer
content.body: SMTP, RSS, podcasts, WhatsApp, etc. to thought feeds. Hosted service or self-host. Solves cold start problem. Revenue from convenience not lock-in.

content.title: Mirror trading via trust
content.body: Trusted partners publish trades as thoughts. Your bot follows scaled by trust score. Because chains show rationale. Beats copy-trading: you pick who to trust, position sizes scale with trust, full audit trail.

content.title: Automatic trust adjustment from outcomes
content.body: Outcomes are attestations. Positive results boost trust, negative results decay it. Position sizing auto-adjusts. A/B test signal sources with allocation rules. Full validation chain for disputes.

content.title: Commercialization: Trust-weighted signal marketplace
content.body: Generalizes beyond trading to any domain with expert signals: hiring, purchasing, security, research, health, legal. Same pattern: trusted source → signed signal → your rules → outcome → trust adjustment. Protocol is the product, everything else is services.

content.title: Disruption map: high-signal hard-to-verify domains
content.body: Civil: journalism, medical opinions, legal referrals, peer review, contractors, appraisals, expert witnesses, certifications. Security: threat intel, cyber attribution, informant handling, chain of custody, OSINT. Government: voting, public records, compliance, licenses. Pattern: expert signals + verification gap + reputation opacity + outcome delay.

content.title: UK property chain coordination
content.body: Property chains fail from poor info flow. WoT solution: every party is identity, every milestone is attested thought. Real-time chain health visibility. Gazumping prevention via reputation. Business: Chain Pool SaaS, solicitor integrations, alerts.

content.title: Patient-controlled medical records
content.body: Medical records as thoughts in your pool. Granular sharing via consultation-specific pools. Emergency access pre-authorized. Provider track records from outcomes. Consent as attestation. GDPR/HIPAA aligned.

content.title: Data silo collapse
content.body: Your pool syncs to your devices. Network is for sync not access. No more 'where is it' - it's always local. Smart sync per device (full/subset/summaries). Provider outage = no sync, not no access. Migration via ingest, not rip-and-replace.

content.title: USB stick portability
content.body: Your pool on a USB stick. Sneakernet is first-class transport. Walk into hospital with USB, share what's needed, no cloud dependency. Air-gapped systems, offline collab, estate planning. Transport agnostic: CIDs verify, signatures prove, transport is plumbing.

content.title: Key recovery via social attestation
content.body: Lost key recovery via same_as attestations from trusted pool members. Threshold-based (3 of 5). Reputation transfers, content stays with old key. Cooling period prevents rush attacks. Pre-designate recovery delegates. No central authority.

content.title: Name and shame with receipts
content.body: Fraudulent attestations are permanently visible. Bad actors exposed via the same chain they created. No platform enforcement needed - the graph is the court of public opinion with evidence. False accusations also require receipts.

content.title: Revocation propagation: poison the root
content.body: Don't counter-attest 100 fraudulent thoughts individually. Revoke the same_as attestations at root with invalid_chain effect. Everything downstream automatically invalid. Real identity owner can revoke claims about themselves. Challenge period + monitoring for early detection.

content.title: Daemon auto-defense against fraudulent same_as
content.body: If daemon still has key, automatically reject same_as claims with proof of possession. Broadcast rejection immediately. Seconds not days. Challenge period protects offline users.

content.title: Pool security model: attack surface analysis
content.body: Challenge period as pool setting. Daemon auto-defense rules. Attack models: collusion without sync, selective sync (forking), admin abuse, reputation laundering, attestation bombing, because chain poisoning, timestamp manipulation, quorum capture, aspect spoofing. Defense in depth: crypto + daemon + rules + network + social + fallback.

content.title: Proof of life: internal tick for daemons
content.body: Daemons continuously create signed heartbeat thoughts (local_forever). On fraud detection, surface tick as proof of key possession. Chained ticks prove continuous access. No need to be online to respond - proof already exists.

content.title: Dead man's switch via tick sharing
content.body: Share tick hashes with trusted peers. Stop ticking = trigger alert. Watchdog has alarm capability not access capability. Handles: lost devices, incapacitation, key theft, death. Estate planning integration.

content.title: Visibility clarification: ticks and secrets
content.body: Ticks are NOT local_forever - they go to watchdog pool. Co-signed by witnesses for multi-party proof. Secrets have granular visibility: local_forever (never), pool:devices (my devices), pool:family (estate), pool:recovery (trustees). Choose boundary per trust requirement.

content.title: Identity Protection Infrastructure added to spec
content.body: Added new section to wot-v0.7.md: proof of life ticks, watchdog pools, dead man's switch, daemon auto-defense, key recovery protocol, revocation propagation. Updated changelog.

content.title: Vouch reaffirmation ceremonies
content.body: Vouches decay unless refreshed. Periodic reaffirmation with out-of-band challenge (share code via Signal/email). Proves voucher alive, still trusts, relationship real. Stale vouches fade. Trust graph maintenance.

content.title: Content trust vs relationship trust
content.body: Thoughts are forever valid (signature proves creation). Vouches need maintenance (relationships change). Old content stays valid, vouch freshness affects current trust weight. Don't conflate historical record with current relationships.

content.title: Device pool as primary key protection
content.body: Multi-device private pools provide automatic key sync. Losing ALL devices is rare failure mode. Explicit backup is optional for most users. Device pool sync encrypted with local_forever visibility.

content.title: Vouch decay is pool-configurable
content.body: Vouches decay over time. Pool config defines: vouch_lifetime, decay curve (linear/exponential/step), refresh prompt timing, zero-at date. Daemon surfaces refresh prompts. Signature lives forever, trust weight decays.

content.title: SAME_AS for identity migration
content.body: Key truly lost with no backup = new identity. New identity creates SAME_AS claim. Others who vouched for old identity re-vouch for new. Not automatic transfer - earns back trust. Deliberately painful to incentivize backup hygiene.

content.title: now.pub Key Custody tier
content.body: Optional paid service: user encrypts key to now.pub custody pubkey, submits blob. Recovery via identity verification (video call, govt ID). 24-hour challenge period. Estate planning integration. Tradeoff: sovereignty vs insurance.

content.title: 2-of-3 Byzantine attack on identity
content.body: Attack: 3-person pool, 2 collude against third to steal identity. Protections: daemon auto-defense if online, tick chains contradict claims, asymmetric stakes (attackers burn identity if victim surfaces), time-locked recovery, external witness required.

content.title: Key rotation ceremony vs recovery
content.body: Two different flows: planned rotation (sign new key with old key, smooth transition, both keys valid during overlap) vs emergency recovery (no old key available, social attestation required). Rotation is cryptographic, recovery is social.

content.title: Enterprise decision platform pattern (Fynite.ai)
content.body: CMDB as proving ground for agentic decisions. Same trust model across verticals: orders, sales, supply chain, risk. Protocol is horizontal, verticals are pool schemas. Escalation = trust threshold. Audit = because chains. Don't build vertical-specific trust engines.

content.title: Root identity never in pools
content.body: Root identity stays local_forever (device pool only). All pool activity via scoped sub-identities vouched by root. Attack surface collapses to delegates. Compromise = revoke + replace, not existential. Paranoid users: paper/hardware. Normal users: device pool auto-sync.

content.title: Literary precedent: The Quantum Thief
content.body: Rajaniemi's gevulot (cryptographic privacy permissions), exomemory (external storage), and gogol (mind copies) map directly to WoT's visibility spectrum, pool-scoped thoughts, and identity verification primitives. Jean le Flambeur's 'which copy is real' problem is solved by proof of life ticks + watchdog pools. Difference: gevulot is city-maintained (centralized), WoT is self-sovereign (distributed).

content.title: Anti-Torment Nexus positioning
content.body: Torment Nexus meme: tech builds dystopian sci-fi. WoT is inverse: gevulot is utopian infrastructure that works, not cautionary tale. Building the good part of the fiction. Self-awareness as differentiator.
